lexUnit.name: guide.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: show or indicate the way to.

sentence.text: He took her arm , guiding her across the broad landing towards another door .
Stephen , offering her his arm , guiding her confidently across the marble floor , was glossy with well-being .
Every day she has to dodge between parked cars and buses when she guides children across the road .
But it was built in 1751 as an inland lighthouse to guide travellers across what was then an empty open and desolate countryside .
It 's a bit like crowd control at a football match -- the retailer guides the customers along a path through his shop !
She guided Kim along the street and began talking ,
Her brother Jeff was guiding them alongside the jetty now .

He guides us among its ` toy-like villas , each different in design and each set against a background of trees A curling road winds through , but not everything is revealed at once : a chimney for but a moment here , a turret window through a gap between two acacia trees , a gable partly concealed by the fretted roof of a conservatory , an almond tree in blossom branching over the pavement , a spot of scarlet colour made by a distant pillar box . "
Community cop : One of the first duties of Netherton 's new community officer , PC John O'Neill was to guide local children around Copy Lane Police Station .
He had guided her expertly around the monuments of Greece and Italy , the summer after the baby .
We do n't actually guide visitors around the reserve , rather leave them to their own devices having informed them about what they 're likely to see and drawn their attention to some safety aspects .
And without doubt , many birds as well as pigeons , are able to guide themselves by the earth 's magnetism .
Instead they guide themselves by the stars , as has also been verified by experiment .
She kept hold of his hand and guided him from the room .
He took the hand she held out to him and guided her inside the cottage .
Ken met me at the entrance and guided me into a side room .
Tracey laughed , and put his hand under her elbow to guide her into the cinema .
Then Melinda kindly guided me outside into the harsh sunlight of the street .

An intelligence officer in Malaya , Captain Patrick Heenan , has been named this week as the traitor who guided Japanese bombers onto British airfields , allowing a rapid advance and the fall of Singapore .
The 1st Battalion The Green Howards will guide the ten-strong team over the demanding course at Catterick Garrison next Sunday .
Cranston muttered and , taking Athelstan by the arm , guided him past the great hall towards the gateway under Wakefield Tower .
` He beat us to it , " she informed Felipe crossly as he guided her through the crowd , protecting her from knocks .
Dieter guided her to an empty chair ; she was trembling violently and he called for brandy .
He guided her backwards to one of the posts which supported the roof .
Sometimes we guide them towards a beacon .
Instead of going straight to the front desk as usual , Charlie guided her towards the restaurant .
He turned his back on the struggling man , put his hand under Lili 's elbow , and guided her towards the saloon .
I guided Doreen away from the grave .
He took her arm and guided her away from Joe 's house and along the street to the gentle hill leading to the graveyard .
Edward danced well , guiding her with confidence , and soon he was holding her very close .
A FATHER and son on a fishing trip were guided to safety yesterday after losing their compass overboard .
The Nez Perce hurried south under the shadow of the Bitterroots , guided now by Poker Joe , since Looking Glass carried the burden for the Big Hole disaster .
Then , lowering the light , he guided us along the banks of a stream to a pond .

Mrs Chamoun guides him around the Emir Bashir 's palace at Beit Eddine ; he is clearly taken in by the mythical Lebanon of happy agrarian masses toiling away under the guidance of a benevolent leader .
When they had fruitlessly exhausted their task , Myeloski called the caretaker to guide them round the rest of the palace .
She had n't even noticed where they were , but now he was guiding her up some stone steps , and she realised by the background music that they were heading for Pepe 's .
